title: The Sweet Corn Cultivation Revolution: Seed to Harvest

tasks.task: Cultivate sweet corn from seed to harvest
subtasks: Select specifically bred sweet corn seeds
Prepare planting soil with rich nutrients and good drainage
Plant seeds at appropriate depth (1 inch) and spacing (8-12 inches apart)
Water plants regularly but avoid overwatering
Protect plants from pests using natural predators or eco-friendly pesticides
Monitor ear development and timing of harvest (when silk turns brown, husk is green)
Minimize time between harvest and consumption
Alternatively, freeze harvested corn for longer storage

tasks.task: Understand the benefits of modern sweet corn cultivation
Reflect on the role of technology in agriculture
subtasks: Recognize the combination of traditional methods and modern technology
Marve at human ingenuity in farming
